page.title: 07Pullen's Fruit Farm
page.content: Mr. Brigdan grows apples, pears, strawberries and raspberries, which he sells to wholesalers, supermarkets and hypermarkets. Ferlilizers are applied in the early spring in granule form by a groundsprayer. He has Bramleys, Coxes, Worcesters, Discoveries, Lambourne and Spartan. Twenty local women pick these in the autumn. The apples are packed, sized and delivered. A new product has been called Apple Dew (apple juice). They have also dabbled in cider. There were 5 acres of Williams and Conners pears. The orchards were on a slope for drainage. The fruits are kept in the {cold store.} The size of the apples most common to Pullen's Farm is 60mm. The size that they prefer is 70mm. There is a little trouble by{squirrels but{rabbits}are often eating the bark off the apple and pear trees.
